LanguageData.CopperBar.label: 铜
LanguageData.CopperBar.description: Copper is an alloy of Copper Ore. It is mainly used for its high conductivity in electrical applications. Copper is not a magnetic metal.
LanguageData.TinBar.label: 锡
LanguageData.TinBar.description: Tin is an alloy of Tin Ore.
LanguageData.Bronze.label: 青铜
LanguageData.Bronze.description: Bronze is an alloy consisting primarily of copper, commonly with about 12% tin and often with the addition of other metals such as aluminium, manganese, nickel.
LanguageData.GoldBar.label: 金
LanguageData.GoldBar.description: Gold is a beautiful, precious alloy of Gold and Copper or Bauxite. Gold is not a magnetic metal.
LanguageData.SilverBar.label: 纯银
LanguageData.SilverBar.description: Sterling Silver is a valuable alloy of Silver and Copper or Bauxite. Sterling Silver is not a magnetic metal.
